thread.title: New law would make college textbooks free
thread.title_full: New law would make college textbooks free

title: New law would make college textbooks free
text:
New law would make college textbooks free Students spend over $1,200 on books annually Published 5:35 AM HST Oct 12, 2015 Photos Ferre' Dollar/CNN More 
The law, called the Affordable College Textbook Act, is being co-sponsored by Sens. Al Franken and Dick Durbin. 
The legislation would compel high education institutions into applying for government grants for the creation of the open textbooks. The books could then be modified by schools to fit specific college courses, reports City Pages. 
A Chicago Tribune report states that the average college student spends about $1,200 on books and supplies annually. 
Durbin introduced similar legislation in 2013 that failed to gain traction, but is pushing the issues again, the Chicago Tribune report said.
